round 24 single_crochet decrease repeat around 12 attach to body round 25 fold together and crochet closed across through the bl of st closest to you and fl of st furthest from you single_crochet x12 12 if you want to lightly stuff the tail do this before closing turn work and continue up work in rounds working in the front loops only flo chain 5 skip 1 st slip_stitch repeat this will make the furry/bushy part of the tail for the first 8-10 row you will work back and forth on back side of the tail alone this will leave an open rectangular/trapezoidal area which will be attached to the body of the squirrel please refer to pictures if you want to attach more of the tail to the body skip more row on the front side finish off with slip_stitch when you reach the top if you want a flatter or fluffier tail you can decrease or increase the # of chain respectively keep in mind that the tail will be heavier if you increase the # of chains and the squirrel will be more difficult to balance also you can skip row intermittently if the tail is getting too heavy i e complete 4-5 row skip 1 row repeat you can also play with the length of the tail if you want to length the tail i would suggest adding to rounds 3-4 6-7 and/or 9-10 if you want a longer tail keep in mind if the tail will be heavier because of this consider skipping 10-12 rounds on the front of the tail to attach a larger area to the body for the orange squirrel see pictures below which i added to 2 row to rounds 6-7 and 1 row to round 9-10 if you want to shorten the tail
